All Pages Posts Now

How These Notes are Organized

tldr

Blog posts for today, cards for persistent thoughts. Store it in Obsidian, build it with Hugo and obsidian-export

also relevant: Why am I doing this

Purpose

Provide a relatively simple structure to let me use folders to organize information along a couple important splits:

short-term vs long-term

I don’t need to keep all my notes forever! Make it easy to see what notes still need to be refactored into some form of long-term memory.

personal vs public

I want to share some of my notes, and maintaining separate vaults doesn’t work for me. Make sure there’s a designated spot for long-term private notes, but also put new notes in a (private) limbo where I know I need to refine and file them.

Guidelines

The guiding thoughts as I add, refine, and trim.

Notes are living documents

this means editing and refinement is core

journals are for the historical record

everything else is there to help me GSD

TBH even journals should be open to editing for clarification and to remove redundant detail

Notes have a predictable internal structure

Every note’s dream is to become the central source of all wisdom for its topic

Key expected components

A summary

Sections for subtopics that have gelled into coherence

A section for incoherent jots about the topic

A section for resources or useful references

Subtopics get split out to their own page if it feels like they’re getting too big But quick jots are okay heading:: true

More important to capture the thought than to capture it perfectly

Notes should eventually fit together organize them in a hierarchy when it makes sense

use platform features to describe rich relationships between notes

Folders
Folder Purpose
_templates skeletal structures for notes
attachments images and other non-text files
card Long-term public notes
inbox spot to capture and process new notes
journal Private records
journal/day Daily journal, some of which gets refactored
journal/jots Long-term but private (contacts, etc)
post Long-form structured material explicitly for a public audience
reference What I read, watch, etc that adds info to other notes

Files

Some folders get an _index file describing the contents of that folder.
